name: analyze_itc_binding_thermodynamics
description: Analyzes isothermal titration calorimetry (ITC) data to determine binding affinity and thermodynamic parameters.

setup_commands: git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/snap-stanford/Biomni.git /tmp/biomni && cd /tmp/biomni && pip install -e . && rm -rf .git

inputs.name: itc_data_path
inputs.description: Path to CSV or TSV file containing ITC thermogram data with columns: 'injection', 'volume', 'heat' (optional)

inputs.name: itc_data
inputs.description: Raw ITC thermogram data as an array (shape: [n_injections, 3]) (optional, for backward compatibility)

inputs.name: temperature
inputs.description: Temperature in Kelvin at which the experiment was conducted (default: 298.15 K / 25¬∞C)

inputs.name: protein_concentration
inputs.description: Initial concentration of protein in the cell in molar (M) (optional, required for accurate fitting)

inputs.name: ligand_concentration
inputs.description: Concentration of ligand in the syringe in molar (M) (optional, required for accurate fitting)

output.description: Research log with binding affinity (Kd), binding enthalpy (ŒîH), binding entropy (ŒîS), and Gibbs free energy (ŒîG)
